meanings.definition: Control or utilize (a source of power)
meanings.sent1: She learned to harness the wind to generate electricity.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harness the sun's energy to grow crops.
meanings.sent3: The clever inventor tried to harness the power of lightning for his experiment.
meanings.sent4: He managed to harness his fear and turn it into motivation.
meanings.sent5: The superhero could harness the power of the stars to fight evil.

meanings.definition: A set of straps and fittings by which a horse or other draft animal is fastened to a cart, plow, etc.
meanings.sent1: The farmer put a harness on the horse before plowing the field.
meanings.sent2: The carriage driver adjusted the harness to fit the horse properly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to wear the horse's harness as a costume.
meanings.sent4: The old harness creaked as the horse pulled the heavy load.
meanings.sent5: The shiny brass buckles on the harness gleamed in the sunlight.
